00035 SYLPH_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00036 class Any;
00037 template<class T> class Array;
00038 
00039 SYLPH_PUBLIC
00040 
00055 template<class T>
00056 class Array : public virtual Object {
00057 private:
00058     size_t _length;
00059 public:
00060 
00064     class iterator : public RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> {
00065     public:
00066         typedef RandomAccessIterator<T, iterator> super;
00067 
00068         iterator(bool begin = false, Array<T>* obj = null)
00069         : super(begin), _obj(obj) {
00070             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : (_obj->length - 1);
00071         }
00072 
00073         iterator(bool begin = false, const Array<T>* obj = null)
00074         : super(begin), _obj(const_cast<Array<T>*> (obj)) {
00075             _currentIndex = begin ? 0 : (_obj->length - 1);
00076         }
00077 
00078         bool equals(const iterator& other) const {
00079             return _currentIndex == other._currentIndex &&
00080                     _obj == other._obj;
00081         }
00082 
00083         iterator(const iterator& other) {
00084             _currentIndex = other._currentIndex;
00085             _obj = other._obj;
00086         }
00087 
00088         typename super::reference current() const {
00089             return (*_obj)[_currentIndex];
00090         }
00091 
00092         bool hasNext() const {
00093             return _currentIndex < (_obj->length - 1);
00094         }
00095 
00096         void next() const {
00097             _currentIndex++;
00098         }
00099 
00100         bool hasPrevious() const {
00101             return _currentIndex >= 0;
00102         }
00103 
00104         void previous() const {
00105             _currentIndex--;
00106         }
00107 
00108         idx_t currentIndex() const {
00109             return _currentIndex;
00110         }
00111 
00112         size_t length() const {
00113             return _obj->length;
00114         }
00115     private:
00116         mutable idx_t _currentIndex;
00117         Array<T>* _obj;
00118     };
00119     S_ITERABLE(T)
00120 public:
00127     typedef bool(*FilterFunction)(const T&, Any&);
00133     const size_t & length;
00134 
00143     inline static Array<T> fromPointer(std::size_t length, T * orig) {
00144         Array<T> ar(length);
00145         for (int x = 0; x < length; x++)ar[x] = orig[x];
00146         return ar;
00147     }
00148 public:
00149 
00156     explicit Array(std::size_t len = 0) : _length(len), length(_length),
00157             data(new Data(len)) {
00158     }
00159 
00170     Array(const std::initializer_list<T> & il) : _length(il.size()), 
00171             length(_length), data(new Data(_length)) {
00172         for (idx_t i = 0; i < il.size(); i++) {
00173             data->_carray[i] = il.begin()[i];
00174         }
00175     }
00176 
00188     template<size_t N>
00189     Array(const T(&array)[N]) : _length(N), length(_length), data(new Data(N)) {
00190         for (idx_t i = 0; i < _length; i++) {
00191             data->_carray[i] = array[i];
00192         }
00193     }
00194 
00203     Array(const Array<T> & other) : _length(other._length), length(_length),
00204         data(other.data){
00205         data->refcount++;
00206     }
00207 
00219     Array(const basic_range<T> & ran) : _length(ran.last() - ran.first()),
00220     length(_length), data(new Data(length)) {
00221         idx_t idx = 0;
00222         for (T x = ran.first(); x < ran.last(); x++) {
00223             *this[idx] = x;
00224             idx++;
00225         }
00226     }
00227 
00238     explicit Array(const T& t) : _length(1), length(_length),
00239             data(new Data(1)) {
00240         data->_carray[0] = t;
00241     }
00242 
00247     virtual ~Array() {
00248         data->refcount--;
00249         if (!data->refcount) {
00250             delete data;
00251             data = null;
00252         }
00253     }
00254 
00255     const T& get(idx_t i) const {
00256         return data->_carray[i];
00257     }
00258 
00259     void put(idx_t i, const T& t) {
00260         data->_carray[i] = t;
00261     }
00262 
00271     Array<T> copy() const {
00272         Array<T> toReturn((std::size_t)length);
00273         for (idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00274             toReturn[i] = (*this)[i];
00275         }
00276         return toReturn;
00277     }
00278 
00284     T * carray() {
00285         return data->_carray;
00286     }
00287 
00294     const T *carray() const {
00295         return data->_carray;
00296     }
00297 
00306     Array<T> filter(FilterFunction func, Any& clientData) {
00307         // I'm terribly sorry but we'll need to iterate twice over the Array...
00308         size_t newlength;
00309         for (idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00310             if (func(*this[i], clientData)) newlength++;
00311         }
00312         Array<T> toReturn(newlength);
00313         idx_t curpos = 0;
00314         for (idx_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00315             if (func(*this[i], clientData)) {
00316                 toReturn[curpos] = *this[i];
00317                 curpos++;
00318             }
00319         }
00320         return toReturn;
00321     }
00322 
00327     void clear() {
00328         delete this->data->_carray;
00329         this->data->_carray = new T[this->data->_length];
00330     }
00331 
00340     Array<T> & operator=(const Array<T> & other) {
00341         if (this->data == other.data) return *this;
00342         this->data->refcount--;
00343         if (!this->data->refcount) delete this->data;
00344         this->data = other.data;
00345         this->_length = other.data->_length;
00346         data->refcount++;
00347         return *this;
00348     }
00349 
00358     T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) throw (Exception) {
00359         if ((idx < (sidx_t)length) && (idx >= -(sidx_t)length)) {
00360             return idx >= 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray[length + idx];
00361         } else {
00362             throw ArrayException("Array overflow");
00363             return data->_carray[0];
00364         }
00365     }
00366 
00374     const T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) const throw (Exception) {
00375         if ((idx < (sidx_t)length) && (idx >= -(sidx_t)length)) {
00376             return idx >= 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray[length + idx];
00377         } else {
00378             return data->_carray[0];
00379             //sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00380         }
00381     }
00382 
00391     Array<T> operator[](const range & ran) throw (Exception) {
00392         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() >= length)
00393             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00394 
00395         Array<T> toReturn = Array<T>::fromPointer((ran.last() - ran.first())+1,
00396                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00397         return toReturn;
00398     }
00399 
00405     const Array<T> operator[](const range & ran) const throw (Exception) {
00406         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() >= length)
00407             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00408 
00409         Array<T> toReturn = Array<T>::fromPointer((ran.last() - ran.first())+1,
00410                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00411         return toReturn;
00412     }
00413 
00414 #ifndef SYLPH_DOXYGEN
00415 protected:
00416 
00417     struct Data {
00418 
00419         explicit Data(size_t length) : _length(length), 
00420                  _carray(new T[length]()), refcount(1) {
00421 
00422         }
00423 
00424         virtual ~Data() {
00425             delete _carray;
00426         }
00427         const size_t _length;
00428         T * _carray;
00429         suint refcount;
00430     } * data;
00431 #endif
00432 };
00433 
00442 template<class T>
00443 inline bool operator==(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00444     if(lhs.length == rhs.length) {
00445         for(idx_t i = 0; i < lhs.length; i++) {
00446             if(lhs[i] != rhs[i]) return false;
00447         }
00448         return true;
00449     }
00450     return false;
00451 }
00452 
00461 template<class T>
00462 inline bool operator<(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00463     return std::lexicographical_compare(&lhs[0], &lhs[lhs.length-1],
00464             &rhs[0], &rhs[rhs.length-1]);
00465 }

00467 SYLPH_END_NAMESPACE
00468 
00469 #endif  /* ARRAY_H_ */
